intro: Schiedea lydgatei, commonly known as the Lydgate's snowplant, is a rare alpine plant native to the Hawaiian island of Maui. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its rosette of fleshy, gray-green leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers during the cooler months, typically from November to February. Schiedea lydgatei is adapted to grow in rocky, well-drained soils at high elevations. Due to its limited distribution and habitat threats, it is listed as endangered by the IUCN.
